business.headline: Good news on India–US trade deal once it's fair and equitable, says Piyush GoyalSpeaking at the Indo-US Economic Summit organised by the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce in New Delhi, Piyush Goyal said negotiations are moving ahead, but a final announcement will come only when the terms are acceptable and mutually beneficial.

What is the 9-9-6 work culture Narayana Murthy wants Indians to learn from?In his latest remarks, Murthy referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 working culture, a system followed by many Chinese tech companies during their rapid growth phase.

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we decode what the number really means for policyholders.
Sensex ends 325 points lower, Nifty closes below 26,000; IT stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 324.96 points to close at 84,625.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 103.40 points to end at 25,910.05.
Fujiyama Power Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusApplicants can now check whether they have received shares through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Rs 5,000 SIP vs Rs 60,000 lump sum: Which creates more wealth in 10 years?Is it wiser to invest Rs 5,000 every month, or does a yearly Rs 60,000 lump sum genuinely create more wealth in the long run? We explore the answer here.
Excelsoft Technologies IPO Opens on November 19: Check GMP and price bandFounded in 2000, Excelsoft Technologies is known for its tech-led solutions in the education and assessment industry.

Why chasing every new IPO can hurt your portfolioChasing every new IPO may feel exciting, but it often does more harm than good. Many recent listings have slipped below their issue price, showing that hype doesn't always translate into real returns.

PhysicsWallah shares up 40% over IPO price: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, giving investors a 33% premium over the issue price of Rs 109. This opening surprised market participants, as the GMP trend had pointed to only a mild gain ahead of the listing.

Has your tax refund been delayed? CBDT chief explains whyIf you're still waiting for your income-tax refund, you're not alone. The CBDT chief has clarified why some payouts are taking longer this year and what the department is doing to speed things up.

Digital gold firms knock on Sebi's door, seek regulatory supervision: ReportWith digital gold gaining traction across India, questions around safety and regulation are becoming louder. Industry bodies and platforms now want formal oversight to boost trust in the fast-growing segment.

PhysicsWallah makes strong market debut as shares list at 33% premiumPhysicsWallah share price: The stock listed at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, marking a sharp 33% premium over its issue price of Rs 109.

Narayana Murthy now cites Chinese 9-9-6 system to back 72-hour work week callIn a recent interview, the 79-year-old billionaire referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 work culture to support his long-held view that young Indians should work longer hours to help India grow faster.

Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade amid a cautious start on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136 points to 84,814.95 around 9:34 am, while the Nifty50 fell 49.95 points to 25,963.50. Sectoral indices were mixed, reflecting the cautious tone among investors.

Why gold, silver prices are falling today and what to expect nextIn India, gold and silver prices also reflected this weakness. As of Tuesday morning, 24-karat gold was priced at Rs 12,343 per gram and Rs 1,23,430 per 10 grams.

PhysicsWallah IPO listing: GMP bounces back, but will investors actually gain?Despite the company's strong brand presence and loyal student base, its IPO received a modest subscription, suggesting that investor sentiment remains cautious.

You're applying for IPOs. But are you funding growth or just promoter exits?The IPO market looks hotter than ever, but the rise of OFS-led offerings reveals a trend most retail investors rarely pause to examine. In Part 2 of The Great IPO Gamble series, we break down what's changing beneath the hype.

US says sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil already cutting Russia's oil revenueThe US Treasury says sanctions on Russian oil majors are lowering revenues and sales. The two largest buyers of Russian oil have been China and India.

Is it possible to improve your credit score without owning a card?Many people assume that a credit card is essential for building a good credit score. But experts say that's not true. With the right financial habits and timely repayments, you can strengthen your credit profile even without owning a card.

India-US trade deal nearing first-phase closure as tariff talks progress: ReportIndia and the US are negotiating a bilateral trade agreement. So far, six rounds of talks have been completed. Both sides have announced plans to finalise the first tranche of the deal by fall of 2025.

entertainment.headline: Penn Badgley says he and wife Domino Kirke nearly divorced after 2 miscarriages Actor Penn Badgley shares how successive miscarriages nearly led to separation from his wife, Domino Kirke, and reflects on their experience of isolation, eventual family growth, and the need for greater openness about pregnancy loss.

Delhi Crime 3 director clarifies why Richie Mehta's name is still on the credits In an exclusive interview with India Today, 'Delhi Crime 3' director spoke about why the show's creator, Richie Mehta's name is still there on the credits.

After The Hunt Trailer: Julia Roberts, Andrew Garfield walk into a moral minefield Director Luca Guadagnino and actor Julia Roberts will receive the Gotham Awards Visionary Tribute, while their film After The Hunt is set for global streaming debut.

When Manoj Bajpayee locked himself in washroom to avoid meeting Amitabh Bachchan Manoj Bajpayee revisits his first meeting with Amitabh Bachchan during 'Satya' screening. The actor shares an emotional encounter and a special hug on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'.

Internet reacts to Dhurandhar trailer: Dear CBFC, don't mess up this time The trailer for the upcoming film 'Dhurandhar', headlined by Ranveer Singh, has sparked a flurry of reactions on social media. With its depiction of intense violence, users are both praising the film's style and expressing concern over its content.

120 Bahadur director Razneesh Ghai details film's intense 6-year prep In an exclusive interview with India Today, director Raneesh Ghai opened up about the massive effort behind bringing one of the world's most defining battles to screen with the upcoming film '120 Bahadur.'

How The Running Man Glen Powell just missed the bus to Hollywood top lot. For now Actor Glen Powell's Hollywood ascent hits a new roadblock as his new film, 'The Running Man', loses to 'Now You See Me' in the box office race, and earns mixed reviews, raising questions about his project choices

Javed Akhtar had tears after watching 120 Bahadur, reveals Farhan Akhtar Farhan Akhtar revealed his father Javed Akhtar was deeply moved by '120 Bahadur'. The film is based on the Battle of Rezang La and is set to release on November 21.

Ocean's 9 Juhu beach edition ft shirtless Akshay Kumar, Tiger Shroff. Watch Akshay Kumar and Tiger Shroff, joined by a group dubbed the 'Desi Boys,' captured public attention during a recent walk along Mumbai's Juhu Beach. The group, led by Kumar, drew significant reactions online for their fitness and camaraderie, as highlighted in a widely shared video.

Vilaayath Budha to Mask: 9 South films to hit theatres on November 21 As many as nine South Indian films are arriving in theaters this week, spanning the Malayalam, Telugu, Tamil, and Kannada languages. Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'Vilaayath Budha' and Kavin-Andrea Jeremiah's 'Mask' are among the films that are due for release.

Actor Elli AvrRam says OTT helped break years of Bollywood stereotyping Elli AvrRam opened up about being stereotyped for years in Bollywood due to her appearance, with many assuming she couldn't speak Hindi. She said OTT platforms finally helped filmmakers see her range and break the typecast image.

Dhurandhar trailer: Ranveer Singh's film unleashes gruesome war against terrorism Ranveer Singh shines in the high-octane 'Dhurandhar' trailer, as the Aditya Dhar film teases a violent, action-heavy battle drama with a powerful ensemble cast. The trailer introduces a revenge-driven plot rooted in India–Pakistan tensions.

Nayanthara reunites with Balakrishna after 7 years in NBK 111, to play a queen On November 18, the makers of 'NBK 111' confirmed that actor Nayanthara will play the role of a queen in the upcoming period drama directed by Gopichand Malineni. The announcement also marks a reunion for Nayanthara and Nandamuri Balakrishna after several years.

Ranveer's Dhurandhar could be a two-part film, echoing Ramayana plan: Report Ranveer Singh's upcoming film 'Dhurandhar' is reportedly a two-part spy thriller. The first part is scheduled for release on December 5, 2025. The second instalment is likely to arrive in the first half of the following year.

Justin Bieber tells fans everything hurts after painful rib injury During a recent livestream, singer Justin Bieber revealed he suffered a rib injury after a fall from his Onewheel skateboard and provided insight into both his recovery and his relationship with wife Hailey Bieber.

Bigg Boss 19: Gaurav Khanna gets emotional as wife Akanksha brings love. Watch Gaurav Khanna's emotional reunion with his wife Akanksha Chamola became the highlight of 'Bigg Boss 19's' Family Week, bringing a rare moment of warmth inside the tense house.

Zubeen Garg's wife Garima Saikia posts emotional note on late icon's 53rd birthday On Tuesday, Garima Saikia Garg marked her late husband and singer Zubeen Garg's 53rd birthday with a personal tribute on social media.

Priyanka Chopra shares photos with 'legends' Mahesh Babu, Prithviraj. See pics Priyanka Chopra shared new photos with Mahesh Babu and Prithviraj Sukumaran as the trio promoted SS Rajamouli's upcoming film 'Varanasi' with international media. Calling it a "privilege" to work with them, she expressed excitement over the global buzz building nearly a year before release.

Huma Qureshi rejects Kajol and Twinkle's take on infidelity: What is this free pass? Actor Huma Qureshi has disagreed with Kajol and Twinkle Khanna's recent comments defending physical infidelity. The actor's remarks contribute to an ongoing debate sparked by a conversation on the show 'Two Much With Kajol and Twinkle'.

general news.headline: Forget politics, I'll leave Bihar: Smarting, Prashant Kishor dares JD(U) againPrashant Kishor said he would "definitely quit politics" if the Nitish Kumar-led NDA government fulfils its poll promise of giving Rs 2 lakh each to 1.5 crore women. Rejecting claims that he plans to exit after Jan Suraaj's defeat, Kishor said he will stay in Bihar and intensify his campaign.

Behind top Maoist Hidma's killing, a story of split, betrayal and dogged huntMadvi Hidma's death in a counter-insurgency operation signals the near-collapse of the Maoist insurgency in India. Hidma, one of the top Maoist commanders, hid from security forces even as he masterminded brutal killings. A split among Maoists and the back-to-back operations against Left-Wing Extremism that got him killed.

Shashi Tharoor braves cold and cough to attend PM's lecture, offers fresh praiseCongress MP Shashi Tharoor observed that PM Modi's message resonated as both an economic assessment and a cultural directive, encouraging citizens to strive for national improvement.

India rolls out next-gen e-passports: A look at key security upgradesIndia is rolling out next-generation e-passports with advanced security features and RFID chips under the upgraded Passport Seva Programme 2.0.
Bhajan Clubbing goes big, and it's selling out like a concertDon't be surprised if the next sold-out rant on social media isn't about a Coldplay concert, but a bhajan-clubbing night.

Suicide bombing very misunderstood, says Red Fort bomber in unseen videoIn the unseen footage, the Red Fort bomber talks about the "misunderstood" concept of suicide bombing. He explains that what is often labelled as a suicide bombing is actually a martyrdom operation in Islam.

Irony dies twice as Jamaat cheers Hasina's BhasmasuraA double irony unfolded as the International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) of Bangladesh gave ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina the death sentence. The ICT was set up by Hasina herself to try those accused of 1971 war crimes. The Jamaat-e-Islami, which lauded the ICT verdict, had the most number of leaders hanged by the tribunal.

Free India from Macaulay's slavery mindset: PM Modi sets 10-year roadmapPrime Minister Narendra Modi urged a national resolve to shed what he called the "Macaulay mindset," launching a 10-year mission to reverse the colonial-era impact of the 1835 education overhaul.

Pak rapper Talha Anjum waves Indian flag, tells critics he'll do it againPakistani rapper Talha Anjum has ignited a controversy after draping an Indian flag around his shoulders during his Kathmandu concert. His waving the Tricolour and draping it were seen as provocative by many. He was singing his diss track 'Kaun Talha' aimed at Indian Gully Gang rapper Naezy when an Indian flag was thrown at him. Anjum caught the flag mid-air and waved it.

Delhi blast co-conspirator had backed out of suicide bombing: Suicide is sinA political science student, Bilal had been radicalised for suicide bombing since 2023 by Umar, arrested doctors revealed during interrogation.

Hasina's downfall: Irony of Bangladesh's cycle of power, justice, aversion to loyaltySheikh Hasina's death sentence symbolises Bangladesh's tragic cycle of power, vengeance, and rewritten history. It is a metaphor for a nation caught between its bloody past and uncertain future, where justice and politics collide endlessly.

Trump backs release of Epstein Files. What's behind this U-turn?In a surprise U-turn, US President Donald Trump has asked House Republicans to vote for the release of the Epstein Files. This is what led to Trump's change of stance on the documents linked to the convicted paedophile and trafficker.

Dhurandhar trailer: Ranveer Singh's film unleashes gruesome war against terrorismRanveer Singh shines in the high-octane 'Dhurandhar' trailer, as the Aditya Dhar film teases a violent, action-heavy battle drama with a powerful ensemble cast. The trailer introduces a revenge-driven plot rooted in India–Pakistan tensions.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Delhi riots attack on India's sovereignty: Centre opposes Umar Khalid's bail in SCThe Centre has taken a firm stand in the Supreme Court, describing the 2020 Delhi riots as a pre-planned and orchestrated attack on India's social fabric. The government opposes bail pleas of key accused, highlighting delays caused by their own legal tactics.

72 hours to greatness? Why Narayana Murthy's 9-9-6 dream is bad economicsChina has dumped the 9-9-6 model, yet we're flirting with it like it's a growth hack. Even the WHO has warned that longer working hours only create more hospital bills than productivity gains! A modern economy focusses on innovation per hour, and not on how many hours we can squeeze out (or in)

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we decode what the number really means for policyholders.

Why Israel may not object to Trump's F-35 jet gift to SaudiDonald Trump surprised one and all by announcing that he would approve the sale of F-35 jets to Saudi Arabia. So far, Israel is the only country in the Middle East to have the jet. What's behind Trump's move?

Delhi blast: Terrorists using Hamas-style tactics India's new headache?Delhi Red Fort blast: The Pahalgam attack had striking similarities to the Hamas massacre in Israel in 2023. Now, it has emerged that the terror module busted in Haryana was planning to carry out Hamas-style attacks using drones.

Chhattisgarh teacher writes 'Fader' for father, 'Noge' for nose during English classThe now-viral video, recorded in a primary school in Chhattisgarh, showed a teacher conducting an English class while writing blatantly incorrect spellings on the blackboard.

Why most Indians blame global warming for extreme weather eventsOver 70% of Indians in all districts say that global warming is causing severe heat waves. To better understand this, we conducted phone interviews with over 19,000 people between 2022 and 2025. Here is what we found.

H-1B petitions by Indian companies fall, Amazon, Meta top 2025 listH-1B visa petitions by Indian companies in FY 2025 dropped by 37% compared to last year's numbers. The drop is a significant 70% compared to a decade ago. US tech giants, Amazon, Meta, Microsoft, and Google, dominated new H-1B approvals.
Lamborghini bypasses toll booth. Video makes Internet say money can't buy classThe viral video, filmed on a highway in India, shows a Lamborghini driving straight through the toll booth.

Congress releases audio alleging CPM pressured booth officer over SIR before suicideCongress released audio clips alleging CPI(M) pressure on Kannur BLO Aneesh George, who died by suicide. The clips capture Aneesh speaking of "trouble" and difficulty working in the area. Congress and BJP have demanded a detailed probe.
Dinesh Vijan announces seven new horror-comedies after Stree 2, ThammaDinesh Vijan announces major expansion of Maddock Films' horror-comedy slate, outlines technology's impact on filmmaking.

Penn Badgley says he and wife Domino Kirke nearly divorced after 2 miscarriagesActor Penn Badgley shares how successive miscarriages nearly led to separation from his wife, Domino Kirke, and reflects on their experience of isolation, eventual family growth, and the need for greater openness about pregnancy loss.

sports.headline: Bangladesh Women's tour of India postponed amid political tensions: Reports Bangladesh's women's cricket tour of India has been postponed, with both boards citing scheduling pressures amid heightened political tensions. The two teams were scheduled to play three ODIs and three T20Is in December.

Babar Azam breaks silence to ex-Pakistan captain on pain of personal attacks Former Pakistan captain Ramiz Raja lifted the lid on a private conversation with Babar Azam, saying the superstar batter expressed his frustration over personal attacks. Babar ended an 807-day wait for an international hundred earlier this month.

Heartbroken Carlos Alcaraz pulls out of Davis Cup due to hamstring injury Carlos Alcaraz withdrew from the Davis Cup Finals with a hamstring injury but still finished the season as the year-end world No.1 after a consistently dominant 2025 campaign.

Jason Gillespie on Kolkata Test row: Hosts must stay out of pitch preparation Jason Gillespie has urged for full freedom for cricket pitch curators without host nation influence. The Kolkata pitch came under the scanner after India's loss against South Africa inside three days.

Tuchel plans talks with sidelined players over England recall before World Cup Thomas Tuchel will meet with omitted England players to clarify selection choices ahead of the 2026 FIFA World Cup. England remain unbeaten and without conceding in Group K, as Tuchel prepares for another training camp before final squad decisions.

PAK vs SL: Babar Azam reprimanded by ICC after striking the stumps in 3rd ODI Babar Azam has been fined and given a demerit point for breaching the ICC Code of Conduct during the third ODI against Sri Lanka. The Pakistan star struck the stumps after his dismissal but accepted the penalty. The sanction comes despite his strong batting performance in the series.

IND vs SA: Nitish Reddy joins team in Guwahati as cover for injured Shubman Gill India all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been added as a cover to the squad for the injured captain Shubman Gill ahead of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati.

Alex Carey not buying into Barmy Army truce, years after Bairstow stumping row Alex Carey is not convinced about the Barmy Army keeping quiet during the Ashes series in Perth. He remains focused on his game despite anticipating a hostile crowd atmosphere.

Medvedev, Kyrgios, Rybakina to headline World Tennis League's India debut World Tennis League is set to make its India debut in Bengaluru in December. Some of the biggest names in tennis, including Daniil Medvedev, Nick Kyrgios, and Elena Rybakina, are expected to compete in the event.

No restrictions: Cameron Green ready to be unleashed as a bowler in Ashes 2025 Cameron Green has said that he will be bowling without any restrictions during the Ashes 2025 series against England. Green has returned to action in the Sheffield Shield and was seen slowly getting up to speed with the ball.

Golf over practice? Aussie media mock Stokes's England before 1st Ashes Test England's Ashes preparations have come under scrutiny after players were seen golfing ahead of the Perth Test. Ben Stokes-led side played only one warm-up match before the series opener, starting February 21 in Perth.

IND vs SA: Nitish Reddy joins team in Guwahati as cover for injured Shubman Gill India all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been added as a cover to the squad for the injured captain Shubman Gill ahead of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati.

Alex Carey not buying into Barmy Army truce, years after Bairstow stumping row Alex Carey is not convinced about the Barmy Army keeping quiet during the Ashes series in Perth. He remains focused on his game despite anticipating a hostile crowd atmosphere.

Medvedev, Kyrgios, Rybakina to headline World Tennis League's India debut World Tennis League is set to make its India debut in Bengaluru in December. Some of the biggest names in tennis, including Daniil Medvedev, Nick Kyrgios, and Elena Rybakina, are expected to compete in the event.

No restrictions: Cameron Green ready to be unleashed as a bowler in Ashes 2025 Cameron Green has said that he will be bowling without any restrictions during the Ashes 2025 series against England. Green has returned to action in the Sheffield Shield and was seen slowly getting up to speed with the ball.

Golf over practice? Aussie media mock Stokes's England before 1st Ashes Test England's Ashes preparations have come under scrutiny after players were seen golfing ahead of the Perth Test. Ben Stokes-led side played only one warm-up match before the series opener, starting February 21 in Perth.

Tore shreds off me: Australia's Khawaja on first encounter with Brendon McCullumAustralia opener Usman Khawaja revealed how his first encounter with England coach Brendon McCullum wasn't a pleasant experience. Khawaja said that the former New Zealand wicketkeeper sledged him mercilessly in 2011.

Indian archers stuck in Dhaka for 10 hours: Forced into unsafe, filthy accommodationIndian archers endured a chaotic return from Dhaka after a cancelled flight left them stranded for nearly 10 hours and forced into filthy, unsafe accommodation without any airline support. The ordeal unfolded amid violence in the Bangladeshi capital, putting several minors and women athletes at risk.

England need to win first two Tests to have a chance of winning Ashes: Stuart BroadFormer England cricketer Stuart Broad believes that the first two Tests will be key for the side's chances to break Australia's Ashes dominance.

Guwahati Test: Ex-India batter says CSK captain should replace Gill if he's ruled outIndia vs South Africa: Aakash Chopra has recommended Ruturaj Gaikwad as a replacement if Shubman Gill is ruled out of the second Test in Guwahati. India fielded as many as six left-handers in the first Test in Kolkata, which they lost by 30 runs.

PAK vs ZIM vs SL T20I tri-series: Livestreaming details and all you need to knowPakistan will welcome Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka to Rawalpindi for a T20I tri-series as both teams aim to gain momentum heading into the T20 World Cup next year. All the matches will be played at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

BAN vs IND: When and where to watch Ryan Williams' debut for Indian football teamThe latest entry to the Blue Tigers, OCI star Ryan Williams, could make his much-anticipated debut for the Indian football team as India takes on Bangladesh. Here's a quick guide on when the match kicks off and where fans can watch the action live.

Shock defeat spurs India to training in Kolkata before Guwahati tripIndia vs South Africa: India players and members of the support staff, led by coach Gautam Gambhir, trained at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, getting in a solid hit in the nets. They made the most of the extra days available after the first Test ended inside two-and-a-half days, with the hosts losing by 30 runs.

NZ vs WI: Daryl Mitchell ruled out of series, Nicholls to remain with squadNew Zealand face a blow with all-rounder Daryl Mitchell sidelined from the ongoing ODI series against the West Indies due to a groin injury. Henry Nicholls, initially called up for the second ODI, will now remain with the squad for the entire series.

PAK vs ZIM vs SL T20I tri-series: Livestreaming details and all you need to knowPakistan will welcome Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka to Rawalpindi for a T20I tri-series as both teams aim to gain momentum heading into the T20 World Cup next year. All the matches will be played at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

BAN vs IND: When and where to watch Ryan Williams' debut for Indian football teamThe latest entry to the Blue Tigers, OCI star Ryan Williams, could make his much-anticipated debut for the Indian football team as India takes on Bangladesh. Here's a quick guide on when the match kicks off and where fans can watch the action live.

Shock defeat spurs India to training in Kolkata before Guwahati tripIndia vs South Africa: India players and members of the support staff, led by coach Gautam Gambhir, trained at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, getting in a solid hit in the nets. They made the most of the extra days available after the first Test ended inside two-and-a-half days, with the hosts losing by 30 runs.

NZ vs WI: Daryl Mitchell ruled out of series, Nicholls to remain with squadNew Zealand face a blow with all-rounder Daryl Mitchell sidelined from the ongoing ODI series against the West Indies due to a groin injury. Henry Nicholls, initially called up for the second ODI, will now remain with the squad for the entire series.

Russell's KKR release wrong, even 4 players like Cameron Green can't cover it: KaifMohammed Kaif has claimed that Andre Russell's release from KKR is wrong and said that four Cameron Greens won't be able to fill the void left by the all-rounder. Russell won the IPL twice with KKR during his 12 seasons with the team.

Germany, Netherlands secure World Cup 2026 qualification with big winsGermany secured World Cup 2026 qualification with a dominant 6-0 victory over Slovakia, finishing top of Group A. Netherlands also confirmed their place in the tournament, remaining unbeaten and defeating Lithuania 4-0 to top Group G.

Smithy's mind was racing: Starc on Hazlewood-Abbott injury blow during Shield tieMitchell Starc revealed the chaos that ensued after Josh Hazlewood and Sean Abbott had to leave the field during the Sheffield Shield match ahead of the first Ashes Test against England. Both Abbott and Hazlewood are ruled out of the match in Perth due to injuries.

After Cairo bronze, Esha Singh aims Asian Games: Want to bring glory to my countryEsha Singh made history by winning her first individual senior world‑championship medal, a bronze in the Women's 25 m pistol at the ISSF World Championship in Cairo. In an interview with Sports Today, Esha talked about doing well in the Asian Games next year.

Sri Lanka Cricketers Return From Pakistan Amid Illness And Security Jitters Over Islamabad BlastThis report covers the sudden return of Sri Lankan cricketers, captain Charith Asalanka and pacer Asitha Fernando, from their tour in Pakistan after falling ill. The development occurred amid heightened security concerns raised by the Sri Lankan squad following a recent suicide bombing in Islamabad. The bulletin states, 'The players recalled for medical care as Sri Lanka cricket avoids specifying nature of illness'. This precautionary decision was made to ensure the players receive proper care and have sufficient time to recover.

Rank turner haunting: When India didn't learn from mistakes during home TestsThe Indian team management's decision to go for a rank turner in Kolkata backfired as South Africa secured a historic win in the first Test. But this wasn't the first time this plan has backfired for India.

Will South Africa bring back Kagiso Rabada for Guwahati Test?IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada didn't play the Kolkata Test, but will the Proteas bring him back for the Guwahati Test with a chance to win a Test series on Indian soil after 25 years?

DRS: Did Gautam Gambhir make the right choice with a rank turner in Kolkata?Gautam Gambhir's decision to request a rank turner at Eden Gardens has sparked debate after India's 30-run defeat. The DRS panel weighs in on whether the strategy suited the team's strengths or exposed its limitations.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
